result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Branden Malik Brown

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Branden Malik Brown not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Branden Malik Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case is adjourned to 12-8-22 at 9:00 am for plea and sentencing in person in Room 504 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Jessica Ann Behling appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jacqueline Dawn Bricco not in court. 
Attorney Tom Harris is in a jury trial in another court and unable to appear today. Case is adjourned to 10-10-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference by zoom.  Parties agreed upon new court date via email.
This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Branden Malik Brown not in court, in custody.  Claire E Zyber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
Defense has no offer yet and is requesting a status conference.  Case is adjourned to 9-13-22 at 1:30 pm for status conference.
  This hearing may be streamed live on DAcast at the discretion of the Court:
https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d84cd54a-763c-3a58-15a9-b84acf306616  Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of PRELIMINARY HEARING ( 20 pages) commencing 06-23-2022 by KAREN M. PALIS .

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10:
Defendant Branden Malik Brown in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Branden Malik Brown in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Bartoshevich. Court took judicial notice of 13CF4190. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Branden Malik Brown not in court, in custody.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Harris was recently appointed. Case was misstabbed to Branch 16. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Branden Malik Brown not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for State V-LEE hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Branden Malik Brown not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Branden Malik Brown not in court, defendant in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Amira R F or Donelle G I.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Branden Malik Brown in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Branden Malik Brown in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branden Malik Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
